type.name: org.gradle.api.plugins.quality.PmdExtension
type.description:
Configuration options for the PMD plugin.
@see PmdPlugin

method.name: getRuleSets
method.description: The built-in rule sets to be used. See the official list of built-in rule sets. Example: ruleSets = ["basic", "braces"]

method.name: getTargetJdk
method.description: The target jdk to use with pmd, 1.3, 1.4, 1.5, 1.6, 1.7 or jsp

method.name: ruleSets
method.description:
Convenience method for adding rule sets. Example: ruleSets "basic", "braces"
param:ruleSets the rule sets to be added

method.name: getRuleSetFiles
method.description: The custom rule set files to be used. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set file. Example: ruleSetFiles = files("config/pmd/myRuleSet.xml")

method.name: getRulePriority
method.description: The rule priority threshold; violations for rules with a lower priority will not be reported. Default value is 5, which means that all violations will be reported. This is equivalent to PMD's Ant task minimumPriority property. See the official documentation for the list of priorities. Example: rulePriority = 3

method.name: ruleSetFiles
method.description:
Convenience method for adding rule set files. Example: ruleSetFiles "config/pmd/myRuleSet.xml"
param:ruleSetFiles the rule set files to be added

method.name: isConsoleOutput
method.description: Whether or not to write PMD results to System.out.

method.name: getRuleSetConfig
method.description: The custom rule set to be used (if any). Replaces ruleSetFiles, except that it does not currently support multiple rule sets. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set. Example: ruleSetConfig = resources.text.fromFile("config/pmd/myRuleSet.xml") @since 2.2

method.name: setTargetJdk
method.description: Sets the target jdk used with pmd. @value The value for the target jdk as defined by TargetJdk#toVersion(Object)

property.name: rulePriority
property.description: The rule priority threshold; violations for rules with a lower priority will not be reported. Default value is 5, which means that all violations will be reported. This is equivalent to PMD's Ant task minimumPriority property. See the official documentation for the list of priorities. Example: rulePriority = 3

property.name: targetJdk
property.description: The target jdk to use with pmd, 1.3, 1.4, 1.5, 1.6, 1.7 or jsp

property.name: ruleSetConfig
property.description: The custom rule set to be used (if any). Replaces ruleSetFiles, except that it does not currently support multiple rule sets. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set. Example: ruleSetConfig = resources.text.fromFile("config/pmd/myRuleSet.xml") @since 2.2

property.name: ruleSetFiles
property.description: The custom rule set files to be used. See the official documentation for how to author a rule set file. Example: ruleSetFiles = files("config/pmd/myRuleSet.xml")

property.name: ruleSets
property.description: The built-in rule sets to be used. See the official list of built-in rule sets. Example: ruleSets = ["basic", "braces"]

property.name: consoleOutput
property.description: Whether or not to write PMD results to System.out.
